title: Jewish homes and businesses defaced with antisemitic graffiti in France
description: At least 10 Jewish homes and businesses around Paris and a synagogue in the northern French city of Rouen have been defaced, according to police, with antisemitism being considered as a motive.

title: US offered to swap Guantanamo prisoner to free detained Americans in Afghanistan
description: The US offered to trade a Guantanamo Bay prisoner in exchange for the release of three Americans held in Afghanistan, a source familiar told CNN.

title: The world’s most powerful passports for 2025
description: An Asian island country is top of the ranking in a newly released report on travel freedoms worldwide.

title: Gold-plated watches and electoral map sneakers: Trump’s newest merchandise raises conflict of interest questions
description: In the two months since the election, President-elect Donald Trump has urged his nearly 8.5 million followers on Truth Social to buy limited edition guitars that bear his signature and Trump-themed fragrances that “represent winning.”

title: ‘Delusional’: SE Cupp slams Schumer’s defense of Biden
description: CNN’s Abby Phillip and CNN commentators Van Jones and S.E. Cupp discuss Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer’s response to questions about Democrats’ defenses of President Joe Biden during the 2024 election, despite mounting concerns about his age.

title: CNN 10: The big stories of the day, explained in 10 minutes
description: Today on CNN 10, we go to southern California where super strong winds are fueling some of the worst wildfires seen in the highly populated area. We also take a look at who is reviving calls for the US to buy the world’s largest island. And we’ll learn about big changes happening on Meta’s platforms that might have you spotting more misinformation on your feeds, before revealing the name voter’s chose for a zoo’s newest baby hippo. All this and more on today’s CNN 10!

title: There’s going to be even more harmful content on social media as Meta drops fact-checkers. What to tell your kids
description: Even before Meta dropped fact-checkers, it could be hard to know what to believe on social media. Parents can help kids sort through posts to learn what’s true.

title: Inside the UAE’s nuclear power plant simulator
description: Barakah, in the United Arab Emirates, is the Arab world’s first nuclear power plant. CNN visits its training facilities and speaks to the CEO of the Emirates Nuclear Energy Company about the future of nuclear energy.

title: Cartoonist resigns after Washington Post axes cartoon criticizing paper’s owner
description: Pulitzer-winning cartoonist Ann Telnaes resigned from The Washington Post after the paper refused to publish her satirical cartoon criticizing owner Jeff Bezos and other tech titans for trying to curry favor with President-elect Donald Trump. How does this latest incident reflect the growing influence of billionaires over the press? Abby Phillip and her NewsNight panelists discuss.

title: Forecasting the Middle East’s economy in 2025
description: CNN speaks to the president of the World Economic Forum and looks at projections for the region’s economy in the year ahead.

title: Trump critic appointed as next archbishop of D.C.
description: Pope Francis appointed vocal Trump critic Cardinal Robert McElroy as the next archbishop of Washington, D.C. What does it signal about the Pope and the Vatican plan to navigate a second Trump administration? Abby Phillip and her panel of analysts discuss.

title: Musk plays politics abroad as world leaders brace for Trump’s return
description: Elon Musk’s personal foreign policy of promoting far-right parties is sparking outrage among leaders in Europe and handing them a dilemma: How do they rebuke the tech titan without angering his new patron — Donald Trump?

title: Jimmy Carter lies in state at US Capitol as Washington honors the former president
description: Former President Jimmy Carter is lying in state in the Capitol Rotunda in Washington, DC, on Tuesday before a funeral service later this week. Follow for live news updates.

title: Tuna the size of a motorcycle sets record at Tokyo auction
description: Tokyo’s renowned Toyosu fish market saw its second-highest price on record for this massive bluefin tuna that auctioned for over a million dollars.

title: It’s the first major decision of Trump 2.0 and Republicans are split
description: Big promises and a small majority.

title: Hollywood productions and events halted due to raging LA wildfires
description: The devastating wildfires that continue to ravage the celebrity-filled enclave of Pacific Palisades and other areas have forced a production shutdown across Los Angeles, as well as the cancellation of a number of key award season events that were set to take place this week.

title: Actor on LA wildfires: ‘It was like an atomic bomb’
FEMA Administrator on Los Angeles fire disaster response
description: Deanne Criswell joins The Lead

title: Visualizing the Los Angeles wildfires in maps and charts
description: A series of life-threatening fires, the largest of which is in the Pacific Palisades, are destroying homes as they race across Los Angeles County and surrounding areas. CNN is tracking the fires in maps and charts.

title: Actress gets emotional reflecting on LA fire destruction
description: Emily Procter joins The Lead

title: Israeli military says hostage found dead in Gaza tunnel, ‘grave concerns’ for second captive
description: The Israeli military said Wednesday it had recovered the body of a hostage from a tunnel in southern Gaza.

title: Wax statue of Netanyahu destroyed at museum in Mexico
description: Video posted on social media shows someone vandalizing a wax statue of Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu at a wax museum in Mexico.

title: Alito spoke with Trump before president-elect asked Supreme Court to delay his sentencing
description: Supreme Court Justice Samuel Alito said he spoke with President-elect Donald Trump by phone this week in support of a former law clerk who is seeking a job in the incoming administration – but the justice said he did not discuss Trump’s pending effort to delay his sentencing.

title: Sen. Elizabeth Warren on Trump nominee hearings
description: Sen. Elizabeth Warren joins The Lead

title: Ex-FBI informant behind fake Biden-Ukraine bribery allegations sentenced to 6 years in prison
description: The disgraced former FBI informant who falsely accused President Joe Biden and his son Hunter Biden of taking a $10 million bribe from Ukraine was sentenced Wednesday to six years in federal prison, according to court records.

title: Billy Crystal and more celebrities impacted by ongoing Los Angeles wildfires
description: As at least four wildfires rage around Los Angeles, numerous members of the Hollywood community have been impacted, including Mandy Moore, Anna Faris and Ricki Lake.

title: Musk plays politics abroad as world leaders brace for Trump’s return
description: Elon Musk’s personal foreign policy of promoting far-right parties is sparking outrage among leaders in Europe and handing them a dilemma: How do they rebuke the tech titan without angering his new patron — Donald Trump?

title: Trump critic appointed as next archbishop of D.C.
description: Pope Francis appointed vocal Trump critic Cardinal Robert McElroy as the next archbishop of Washington, D.C. What does it signal about the Pope and the Vatican plan to navigate a second Trump administration? Abby Phillip and her panel of analysts discuss.

title: Potentially crippling port strike averted after dockworkers, ports and shipping companies reach a tentative deal
description: The United States Maritime Alliance said on Wednesday it reached a tentative agreement on a new six-year master contract with the International Longshoremen’s Association.

title: Israel to conceal soldiers’ identities after Brazilian probe into war crimes allegations
description: Israel’s military has announced new media engagement rules for its members after a Brazilian court ordered an investigation into war crime allegations against a soldier visiting the country.

title: Rays commit to Tropicana Field repairs, but time is ticking for 2026 opener
description: After some uncertainty, the Tampa Bay Rays now support a $55.7 million city plan to repair hurricane-shredded Tropicana Field in time for the 2026 season opener, while the team prepares to play this year at the New York Yankees’ spring training home in nearby Tampa.

title: Cold snap grips northern Texas to mid-Atlantic as storm moves offshore
description: A deadly winter storm is pummeling Washington, DC, and the mid-Atlantic Monday after causing hundreds of crashes and flight cancellations and knocking out power to hundreds of thousands in the central United States over the weekend.

title: ‘Delusional’: SE Cupp slams Schumer’s defense of Biden
description: CNN’s Abby Phillip and CNN commentators Van Jones and S.E. Cupp discuss Senate Majority Leader Chuck Schumer’s response to questions about Democrats’ defenses of President Joe Biden during the 2024 election, despite mounting concerns about his age.

title: Seattle police officer who struck and killed graduate student from India fired
description: Seattle’s interim police chief said Monday that she has fired a police officer who in 2023 struck and killed a graduate student from India while responding to an overdose call.

title: Inside the UAE’s nuclear power plant simulator
description: Barakah, in the United Arab Emirates, is the Arab world’s first nuclear power plant. CNN visits its training facilities and speaks to the CEO of the Emirates Nuclear Energy Company about the future of nuclear energy.

title: Azerbaijan’s leader accuses Russia of passenger jet crash ‘cover up’ in blistering new attack on neighbor
description: Azerbaijan’s leader on Monday accused Moscow of carrying out a “cover up” over a passenger jet crash last month that claimed 38 lives, as relations sour between the two neighbors.

title: Forecasting the Middle East’s economy in 2025
description: CNN speaks to the president of the World Economic Forum and looks at projections for the region’s economy in the year ahead.

title: Spanish woman killed by elephant in Thailand while bathing animal, police say
description: A Spanish woman was gored to death by an elephant while bathing the animal at a sanctuary in southern Thailand on Friday, according to local police.

title: US Steel and Nippon sue Biden administration, Steelworkers union and Cleveland-Cliffs over their blocked merger
description: US Steel and Nippon, whose $14.3 billion merger was blocked by President Joe Biden last week, filed a lawsuit against the US government Monday, claiming Biden’s executive order to bar the companies from combining was signed for “purely political reasons.”

title: Pope appoints Trump critic to be archbishop of Washington, DC, and appoints first female leader of a Vatican department
description: Pope Francis has appointed Cardinal Robert McElroy, a vocal defender of migrants and critic of Donald Trump’s first administration, as the next archbishop of Washington, DC.

title: Jon Stewart points out irony at Harris’ election role
description: “The Daily Show” host Jon Stewart notes the twist of fate in Vice President Kamala Harris’ role in the certification of Donald Trump’s election win.

title: This alien plant is lethal for the environment. Now it’s being turned into a plastic to regrow forests
description: Invasive plant species cost the global economy billions of dollars. In Kenya, water hyacinth may have finally met its match.

title: Imprisoned Egyptian-British activist’s mother  marks 100 days of hunger strike, says family
description: Tuesday marks 100 days since 68-year-old Laila Soueif started a hunger strike in a plea to the UK government to free her son from imprisonment in Egypt, according to her family.

title: Her husband died after they moved to Spain. Now this American woman says she’s determined to live their dream
description: Madeline Waid and her husband Jim left the US in 2019 to live out their retirement together in Spain. But just two years later, Jim was diagnosed with terminal cancer.

title: Violence surges in West Bank as three Israelis killed and reprisals reported
description: Multiple Israeli settler attacks against Palestinians have been reported in parts of the occupied West Bank after gunmen killed three Israelis and injured eight others earlier on Monday in the latest explosion of violence there.

title: Scouting the city, setting a fire and bringing in supplies: Here’s how the NOLA suspect planned the attack
description: Nearly a week after Shamsud-din Jabbar rammed a pickup truck into a busy crowd celebrating New Year’s in New Orleans, killing 14, details of how he planned the attack are becoming clearer.

title: Why the clock is already ticking on the new GOP congressional majority
description: The Republican Congress that began its first full week of work on Monday is already operating on borrowed time – unless the GOP can defy one of the most powerful patterns of recent US politics.

title: ‘I wouldn’t even go to practice’: Why are elite-level athletes so into video games?
description: Snooker Triple Crown winners, slam dunk kings, NBA champions and plenty more are really into video games with some struggling to turn off the console. But why?

title: ‘It’s a very different beast’: Rio Ferdinand calls for ‘long-term thinking’ amid turbulent times at Manchester United
description: Rio Ferdinand knows first-hand the weight of expectation that comes with donning the iconic red colors of Manchester United.

title: Talks to avert another potentially crippling port strike set to resume
description: Negotiations aimed at heading off a new strike at the ports up and down America’s East and Gulf Coasts are set to resume Tuesday.

title: ‘Money excuse must stop’: Thibaut Courtois urges soccer to use NBA as reference point in calendar congestion crisis
description: In an interview with CNN Sport’s Amanda Davies, Real Madrid goalkeeper Thibaut Courtois looked to the NBA for a solution to soccer’s calendar controversy.

title: Who could replace Justin Trudeau?
description: Polo Sandoval speaks to New York Times journalist Ian Austen about who could replace Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau after he announced he will step down as Liberal Party leader.

title: 5 things to know for Jan. 7: Trump’s agenda, Trudeau resigns, Bird flu, Deadly earthquake, Medical debt
description: CNN’s 5 Things AM brings you the news you need to know every morning.

title: McDonald’s biggest menu shakeup in years rolls out Tuesday
description: McDonald’s eagerly anticipated new value menu is rolling out to restaurants Tuesday, marking the chain’s biggest change in several years.

title: British tennis player Cameron Norrie apologizes after accidentally hitting fan with racket
description: British tennis player Cameron Norrie has apologized after throwing his racket and accidentally striking a spectator during a 6-2, 6-3 loss to Facundo Díaz Acosta at the Auckland Classic.

title: Canada’s PM Justin Trudeau announces resignation
description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has announced his resignation as leader of the ruling Liberal Party. He said he will remain prime minister until a new leader is chosen.

title: Florence Pugh says her ‘Midsommar’ role left her ‘broken for a long while’
description: Florence Pugh is hesitant to play another role like the one she portrayed in 2019 horror “Midsommar,” saying she felt like she “abused” herself and was “broken for a long while afterwards.”

title: Driver jumps from car sliding on ice
description: Video captured the moment a driver bailed out of a moving car on Saturday as it slid on black ice down an off-ramp in Kansas City, Missouri, after the area was hit by a major winter storm. Tow truck company owner DJ Adamson reached out to Houston DeFoe, who posted the video, and was able to recover the car when the roads cleared up. CNN has reached out to the driver for comment.

title: To heal America’s ills, outgoing surgeon general offers ‘parting prescription’: stronger community
description: As US Surgeon General Dr. Vivek Murthy nears the end of his second term as the nation’s doctor, a final diagnosis of his patient suggests that a great deficiency of connectivity has led to a poor prognosis for America’s overall health and well-being.

title: President Biden to establish two new national monuments in California
description: Biden has federally protected 1,053,125 square miles of land and ocean in his term — an area nearly four times the size of Texas.

title: Macron’s claim that Africans failed to say ‘thank you’ for French military aid sparks outrage
description: African governments have criticized a speech by French President Emmanuel Macron in which he said that some leaders showed “ingratitude” for the deployment of his nation’s troops in the Sahel region in battling Islamist extremism.

title: Waymo passenger nearly misses his flight after car drives in circles
description: The robotaxi looped a parking lot about eight times until Waymo support remotely pulled the car over.

title: Hollywood Minute: How Emma Stone’s ‘blackmail’ led to Kieran Culkin’s Golden Globe
description: Stone’s role in Kieran Culkin’s ‘A Real Pain’ performance, and a look at George A. Romero’s ‘Resident Evil’ movie that never was. David Daniel reports.

title: What we know about the 2 bodies found in wheel well of JetBlue plane
description: Two people were found dead in the wheel well of a JetBlue plane from New York City after it landed at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, the airline said. The discovery is the latest in a string of incidents that have raised concerns over airline security. CNN’s Carlos Suarez joins John Berman to discuss.

title: ‘There is a lot of norovirus out there’: Dr. Gupta shares tips to avoid getting sick
description: Norovirus, a common stomach bug sometimes called the ‘winter vomiting virus,’ is surging in the US. CNN’s Dr. Sanjay Gupta shares what he knows about the outbreaks and what you can do to keep from getting infected.

title: ‘Major reversal’: Reporter lays out new policy changes for Meta
description: Mark Zuckerberg announced that Meta will adjust its content moderation policies on Facebook and Instagram, getting rid of fact checkers and replacing them with user-generated “community notes.” CNN’s Clare Duffy discusses Meta’s changes.

title: Target taps Tom Holland’s star power for Dry January
description: After successfully cornering the spirits section, celebrities now are aiming for the non-alcoholic aisle, with Tom Holland among the first A-listers making perhaps the biggest deal yet.

title: 5 stories to start your day
description: Former President Jimmy Carter’s casket to be taken to the US Capitol, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau announces resignation, McDonald’s to back off some of its diversity, equity and inclusion practices, and much more on today’s episode of 5 Things. Sign up for our newsletter at CNN.com/5Things and watch more at CNN Max.

title: Jean-Marie Le Pen, founder of France’s far-right National Front party, dies at 96
description: The father of Marine Le Pen and the defining figure of France’s postwar far-right movement, has died.

title: Sending a monthly postcard can help you practice gratitude
description: The holidays are over, but you can keep spreading gratitude. Try writing one postcard a month to show appreciation for your loved ones.

title: ‘It’s golf, but it’s reimagined’: Everything to know about TGL, Tiger Woods’ and Rory McIlroy’s high-tech indoor golf league
description: After years of anticipation, the high-tech indoor golf league spearheaded by two of the sport’s modern greats is finally ready to tee off Tuesday night.

title: 11 Yemeni detainees at Guantanamo Bay transferred to Oman
description: Eleven Yemeni detainees at Guantanamo Bay have been transferred to Oman, marking yet another detainee transfer from the military prison in the final days of the Biden administration.

title: Trump Jr. speaks to reporters in Greenland after father’s interest in buying island
description: Donald Trump Jr. is in Greenland after his father President-elect Donald Trump called for US ownership of the island. Kuno Fencker, who is a member of Greenland’s parliament, discusses Trump’s remarks.

title: Russia claims capture of eastern Ukrainian town as fighting rages in Kursk
description: Russia has claimed that its forces captured a battered but strategic town in Ukraine’s eastern Donetsk region, a day after Kyiv launched a counterattack in the Russian region of Kursk.

title: ‘MSN reunion? Football is full of surprises’: Neymar hints at revival of famed trio in CNN exclusive as he targets World Cup
description: In an exclusive interview with CNN Sport’s Amanda Davies, Brazilian soccer superstar Neymar hints at a possible reunion of Barcelona’s famed MSN trio as well as his hopes to play in the 2026 World Cup.

title: Zendaya and Tom Holland: A timeline of ‘Tomdaya’
description: It’s no surprise that Zendaya and Tom Holland have not rushed to publicly confirm whether or not they may be engaged after speculation sparked at the Golden Globes.

title: Orca mom is carrying a dead calf for the second time, raising concerns among scientists
description: Tahlequah, the Southern Resident orca who carried her dead calf for 1,000 miles over 17 days in 2018, is mourning the loss of another newborn, raising concerns about her health.

title: The cities with the hottest housing markets, according to Zillow
description: Potential home shoppers in the Northeast and Midwest may be in for disappointment: Despite signs of cooling in the last year’s intensively competitive housing market, a new report from Zillow says some areas will stay competitive this year.

title: US determines Sudan’s RSF paramilitary group committed genocide in country’s civil war
description: Sudan’s Rapid Support Forces (RSF) have committed genocide over the course of the more than year-long civil war in Sudan, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken said on Tuesday.

title: Tesla under investigation for parking retrieval feature crashes
description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration has launched an investigation into crashes It said occurred while Tesla vehicles were operating with a parking feature that allows owners to summon a car from a parking space without anyone being in the vehicle.

title: Bad news for homebuyers in the Northeast and Midwest
description: The housing market is beginning to show signs of a slight cooling, but home shoppers in the Northeast and Midwest may be disappointed by the ongoing competition for homes this year.

title: San Francisco 49ers receiver Ricky Pearsall forgives teenager who shot him in the chest
description: San Francisco 49ers wide receiver Ricky Pearsall said he wants to meet and forgive the person who shot him in the chest during an attempted robbery last year.

title: Pamela Anderson is ‘The Last Showgirl’
description: Anderson is joined by Jamie Lee Curtis in a story of a seasoned Las Vegas dancer who has to rethink her future. Rick Damigella reports.

title: Meredith Vieira’s husband Richard Cohen dies after living with multiple sclerosis for more than 50 years
description: Richard Cohen, a journalist who was married to former “The View” co-host Meredith Vieira for 38 years, has died after living with multiple sclerosis for decades, it was announced Tuesday on “Today.”

title: CNN’s Daniel Dale corrects Trump’s false claims about Jan. 6
description: President-elect Donald Trump made a series of false claims about January 6 and the presence of guns at the Capitol during a press conference Mar-a-Lago. CNN’s Daniel Dale fact checks Trump’s claims.

title: Here’s the latest sign the job market is cooling
description: The “Great Stay” deepened in November as the number of people who quit their jobs that month dropped to under 3.1 million, a level not seen since the height of the pandemic.

title: Donald Trump Jr. is visiting Greenland weeks after his father said he wanted to buy it. Here’s why
description: Donald Trump Jr. is visiting Greenland just weeks after his father President-elect Donald Trump called for US ownership of the island. CNN International Correspondent Fred Pleitgen explains why Trump is interested in buying the autonomous arctic territory - which is part of the Kingdom of Denmark - and what strategic importance it would bring the US.

title: Driver pleads not guilty to charges in deaths of NHL star Johnny Gaudreau and brother
description: Sean Higgins, the suspected drunken driver accused in the deaths of former NHL star Johnny Gaudreau and his brother last year, pleaded not guilty to all charges stemming from the fatal crash.

title: Mark Zuckerberg’s MAGA makeover will reshape the entire internet
description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg is making sweeping changes to the social internet, all in line with the desires of President-elect Donald Trump and his supporters.

title: Americans’ rage at insurers goes beyond health coverage – author of ‘Delay, Deny, Defend’ points to 3 reforms that could help
description: My book “Delay, Deny, Defend: Why Insurance Companies Don’t Pay Claims and What You Can Do About It” was thrust into the spotlight recently, after UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson was shot and killed in what authorities say was a targeted attack outside the company’s annual investors conference. Investigators at the scene found bullet casings inscribed with the words “delay,” “deny” and “depose.”

title: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck settle their divorce
description: Jennifer Lopez and Ben Affleck have settled their divorce, about four months after Lopez petitioned to end their marriage, according to court documents obtained by CNN.

title: Trump doesn’t rule out using military to take control of Panama Canal
description: President-elect Donald Trump would not rule out using the military to wrest control of the Panama Canal and Greenland during remarks to the press.

title: Former CIA Director on 2025’s biggest challenges
description: Christiane Amanpour speaks to General David Petraeus about American foreign policy as Donald Trump returns to the White House.

title: The Washington Post lays off roughly 100 staffers as star journalists exit
description: The Washington Post on Tuesday laid off roughly 100 employees across its business division, the latest indication of the newspaper’s financial woes after subscribers and staffers revolted over owner Jeff Bezos’s decision to block an endorsement of Vice President Kamala Harris.

title: NY appeals court rejects Trump’s emergency request to delay Friday hush money sentencing
description: A New York appeals court judge has rejected Donald Trump’s request to postpone his Friday sentencing in the hush money case.

title: Medical debt soon will be banned on credit reports
description: Americans won’t have to worry about unpaid medical bills damaging their credit reports and scores much longer.

title: Meta is getting rid of fact checkers. Zuckerberg acknowledged more harmful content will appear on the platforms now
description: In a number of sweeping changes that will significantly alter the way that posts, videos and other content are moderated online, Meta will adjust its content review policies on Facebook and Instagram, getting rid of fact checkers and replacing them with user-generated “community notes,” similar to Elon Musk’s X, CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced Tuesday.

title: Trump warns ‘all hell will break out’ if Gaza hostages aren’t released before his inauguration
description: President-elect Donald Trump warned that if the hostages whom Hamas is still holding in Gaza are not released by his inauguration on January 20, “all hell will break out in the Middle East” – offering one more stark indication of how much the incoming president would prefer to avoid inheriting the Israel-Hamas war as he prepares to take office in less than two weeks.
